Reviews.Title: “Waste of Time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne L
Reviews.Content: The absolute worst hotel experience ever. Hotel in sad repair, Foundation looked disgusting. Police were called for drunk out of control guests, parties on both sides of our room...upon check in. Key did not work, when we asked for a key that worked and if we could have a quiet room, we were refunded our money and told we were too much trouble. We never even got in the room! The staff was EXTREMELY rude and while waiting for 4 hours to check in the staff gossiped very loudly in the lobby about other guests. Was told hotel was in Foreclosure and they were only allowed a limited staff for an excuse to why we could not be checked in until the clock stuck 3:00 and then a shift change and the next staff was late and ruder than the 1st. DO NOT recommend anyone attempt to stay here!!!!! Definately did not feel safe at all! Very glad money was refunded and did not have to experience the interior of a room.

Reviews.Title: “what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: k g
Reviews.Content: Just need to remember you get what you pay for, so this is fine. It is not at Maingate!! You will always need to take a journey to Disney!! If you want something more posh then PAY FOR IT. The rooms are adequate - did you come to Disney to stay in the room all the time???

Reviews.Title: “Don't put us in rooms that are not renovated yet!”
Reviews.Author: keeprothestrz
Reviews.Content: I can totally understand hotels going through renovations and we LOVE that you do renovate. The problem I had with this hotel was that they put us in a room that had not been renovated yet. If the room is not NEW don't give it to someone to stay in just to get their money The kitchen had an ant problem so they kindly moved us to another room which also had an ant problem. Now grant you, the room was very inexpensive but no one wants to have bugs in their room, no matter what the price. I also did not feel safe here. I had stayed here before year after year but this is the worst I have seen this place. I only live an hr from this location but I will not stay here until this place is finished. They should be ashamed of themselves giving out rooms that are old, musty and ant infested just to make a buck!

Reviews.Title: “under new management finally”
Reviews.Author: robinc36
Reviews.Content: we vist this hotel twice a year, and it has gone down hill the last few years. when we arrived i noticed changes taking place. I ask the front desk, and they said it was under new managment, I was then introduced to the new general Manager. He was very nice, and engaging. He told us that improvements were being made, and if there was anything we needed to let him no personally. The rooms were much cleaner, and there was activity all around from the staff. I'm very happy to see this very affordable vacation spot finally being brought back to life. I would recomend it once agian.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe Day's Inn lets this place carry it's name!!”
Reviews.Author: lorimessing
Reviews.Content: We had a party of eight, including small children and requested a connecting room.. After a long day at DISNEY, we checked in at 10"30 pm. First off, we did not get connecting rooms but had two rooms next to each other, which was fine. However, when we pulled the bedspread and blanket down on one of the children's beds, it had glitter and lint all over it. I called the front dest at11:05 to request new sheets and was told that housekeeping was gone for the night so I could not get another set. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?? SOMEONE ELSE COULD'NT HAVE GOTTEN ME SOME?? I ended up taking the sheets of of my bed and sleeping on top of the bedspread all night- fully dressed. The bathrooms were disgusting. peeling paint above the showers,dirty wall paper, bugs in the lights and vents full of hair and who knows what else. The air conditioner would not shut off and had to be unplugged, the phone would'nt stop beeping because someone before us apparantly had a message come in. It also had to be unplugged, the volume button on the TV did'nt work and the room smelled musty.. The pool had an area that was taped off for who know;s what reason. The worst part however was the initial walk to our rooms. We were poolside, which meant that we had to walk past inner corridor rooms. The paint was peeling off many of the doors and upon passing one room in particular, the drapes were pushed up up against the window and were fuill of large stains. It looked to us like someone could have been murdered there. Not a very welcoming sight. The next morning I called and asked for the manager on duty. I requested that he come to our rooms but told that he was busy, so he sent housekeeping in his place. She was very friendly and apologetic as I guided her through our complaint list. I was told that a new owner had taken over recently. Well, they certainly have their work cut out for them! I was told that the stained drapes room was only used for storage. I asked her to look at it through the eyes of a guest and she agreed that it was bad. Upun checking out (and cancelling our second night's stay,) I asked for their corporate office phone number. I was told that it wouldn't matter because this hotel was independently owned.. I have contacted them anyways and was told that any franchisee must maintain the Day's Inn standards or risk losing the franchise. Good luck with this one. We booked rooms at Disney where the rooms were clean, had a usable pool, restaurants that were actually open late, and wonderful activities for the children. I ABSOLUTELY DO NOT RECCOMMEND THIS PLACE AND WARN ANYONE WHO DARES TO STAY HERE TO RE THINK IT. I ALSO TOOK PICTURES OF EVERYTHING AND HAVE THEM AS PROOF FOR THE MANAGEMENT TEAM IF REQUSTED- OR IF THEY ARE NOT TOO BUSY TO LOOK AT THEM.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: RobCoquitlam_BC
Reviews.Content: Most of the Days Inns are usually older properties that are definitely budget orientated. We certainly didn't expect much but on arrival, the night clerk was shall we say, not service orientated and we got a room where the doorlock didn't function at all. Even maintenance couldn't get into the room so we were given a different room that was supposed to be a better room. If it was better, we definitely would not have liked to have had the first one that we were given and things went downhill from there. The wireless internet didn't work in our building, advertised daybreak breakfast not available and the sheets were the wrong size for the bed (not fitted and double sheet on a queen), were some of the issues. I made the booking through the Days Inn Website and today it doesn't seem to be listed anymore. Hmmmm, the question is why??? Would I recommend this motel/hotel......No, give it a pass

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: thewhitetiger16
Reviews.Content: Theres no Breakfast, no internet and you can find better hotels with these amenities for a cheaper price.'No microwave and fridge as well. Also the front desk agent lied to us. She told us at the check in we have internet at home and when we arrived there there wasn't any signal. Also when I called her to be sure she was very very rude. Don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: NdExplorer
Reviews.Content: Went on a trip to Disneyworld with family members (including young children). With a $36/night rate, and attractive photos on the website, we thought we'd found a great deal. Wrong.... when we drove up to check-in, we initially thought it was closed down - some joked condemned. The front lobby was run-down and worn. Since it was late we decided to take our chances. When we walked into the rooms one of the young kids, with a horrid look on her face, asked if we could drive the two hours back to Orlando and stay there. The rooms smelled, and it looked like it'd been a while since the carpets had been cleaned. The next morning members of the other room complained of bugs crawling out of the faucet, bedbug bites and the smell of mold. The pool was closed with a brown tint to it. The kitchen was also closed. Don't believe the photos on the website - we couldn't leave fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good for $”
Reviews.Author: sherryM95
Reviews.Content: I was there with my family. Hotel was at reasonable price, clean good staff. I saved lot of money, to spend on other thing. I will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “We was there 10 days no clean bedding, room or bathroom wasnt cleaned,once”
Reviews.Author: pen64d
Reviews.Content: The room was very smelly, the toilet was very loose, the Resturant was closed, it had no gift shop, like it says, the bar around the pool was gone, the pool was VERY dirty, it had dead insects around the edge, no shade around the pool area, no life guard. Also when we checked in they said I owed them $38 when I asked why he said i dont know,Then he said he will check it out when I refused to pay it. They never asked for it again. I will say the location is fantastic right next door to the Old Town, very close to great resturants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Hard Earned Money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: UpsetCustomer0710
Reviews.Content: Ten words: Report to Health Department, Horrible, Smelly and Shut it Down!!!!! Days Inn should remove their name from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable play to stay”
Reviews.Author: rwarfield
Reviews.Content: Very clean place service was wonderful. Carlo was wonderful with anything we need. Love the staff and cleaning women was on point. The only thing was the internet was not working but that is ok. The price is affordable and the room where clean and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the dirtiest hotels !!”
Reviews.Author: SamHakim
Reviews.Content: Is this what Days Inn is heading towards? All sheets, towels, blankets were dirty. Management didn't care. Days Inn Guest Relations says this is normal for a "high occupany" hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for your Budget”
Reviews.Author: Frugalvalen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hotel for your budget you get what you paid for. It is close to Old Town and Funspot Action Park. Two only problem I must report, keys were not working due to the humidity, and the water was out for at least 2 hours due to a problem. But overall, this hotel was a bargain and good for our family budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for budget conscious travelers”
Reviews.Author: travellover36
Reviews.Content: Hello, My family and I have stayed numerous times at this hotel. We are from Florida and go to Disney World at least once a year. It is NOT luxurious by any means, but if all you are looking for is an apparently clean space with acceptable beds to just sleep in, I highly recommend it. I say apparently clean because to be honest I have never really closely inspected the rooms, but I have stayed there at least 5 times and have never seen bugs, or hairs or anything on the sheets. The beds are ok by our standards.... not sure if they are very comfortable or we just don't notice because when we get back to the hotel we are usually exhausted but we have always slept great; all of us! We are usually 4 and we stay in one room. The location is excellent! If you are going to WDW, you are soo close and if you are going to any of the other parks, I think the affordability of this place easily makes out for the little extra driving. In short, if you are not very complicated and all you need is a clean bed to rest because you want to save your money to spend on fun things, I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, old and it stinks”
Reviews.Author: gfreegfree
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel ever. There are holes in the floors. Everything in the rooms looks dirty. The smell is really bad. Thank god we only booked one night.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recomend this Hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: Melorey
Reviews.Content: The room was very Dirty I had white socks on and My sock where dirty by the time I checked out. The Furniture was falling apart like the dresser. Dirty Linen. Would never ever stay at this hotel again or recomend after I complaint to the corporate office I was supposed to get a check in the mail didn't get it so I called back they send it to the wrong addrese and they send it out again never recieved it. Lousey customer service for day's inn.

Reviews.Title: “great place, good price”
Reviews.Author: mary12Baytown_TX
Reviews.Content: Against the bad reviews I decided to book my stay at this hotel and I was surprised to find out that, at least from what I saw, the hotel was nice, clean and in a great location. I traveled with my husband, my daughter and my two little chihuahuas. The employees were all very friendly. Security was at sight and doing rounds. I felt safe to walk my little darlings at any time. We loved the location. It is close to all the area's main atractions. We also loved the fact that is next to "Old Town"(Shopping strip).

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location.”
Reviews.Author: USA4eva
Reviews.Content: Checked room out before deciding to stay, no problems. Poolside room, could be a bit noisy on times. Room cleaned and beds and towels changed daily. Fridge and microwave in room, so did not use the on site restaurant for breakfast, also iron,ironing board and coffee maker. Not five star but quite adequate for the time spent at the hotel, and the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “not good at all”
Reviews.Author: a1mee
Reviews.Content: desperately needs decorating and modernising throughout.no shop or pool bar as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “They should be ashamed”
Reviews.Author: datdamsmoke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in and from the get go things went downhill. The room had a mildew smell and this was a nonsmoking room. The A/C was not working but we blamed that on the heat at first. We left to Old Town and came back later to discover the room was actually more heated now with the blinds CLOSED!!!! The front desk blamed this on the "Humidity". We changed room to a smoking room and instantly felt better. It smelled better and the A/C was cooler than a polar bears toenail. I would not recommend this dump or be staying in any other dumps operated by this operating company

Reviews.Title: “motel hell....don't trust their internet photos!”
Reviews.Author: kimmikazee
Reviews.Content: I never expected a 5 star hotel at this price. My x did quality assurance audits for hotels at all levels, from budget properties to Ritz and Four Seasons level. I accompanied him on many trips and helped as a secret shopper on many occasions. So I feel like I have pretty reasonable expectations. For around 40 bucks, I expected nothing more than a clean, safe place for my son and I to rest our heads. Ya, not so much. The entire property is in a SERIOUS state of disrepair. Walkways and walls, ceilings, etc. show signs if long-term and serious water damage. Our room, for the most part was clean. (bedding, bath, carpets. etc.) But here too were signs of major water damage, musty odor, etc. Unfortunately, there were many events going on in the area last weekend, and after spending about an hour looking for another room, we decided that since the bed and bath were clean, we could stick it out for the night. The pool was clean and in good repair, so we spent most of the evening there. I took my 10 yea old upstairs at around 6 to watch some tv and settle in. They do not even have the most basic of cable! 3 network stations, Univision and a couple of tourist info channels. There is HBO- fine for me, but not much kid appropriate on a Saturday night. No problem, just get pay per-view, right? 14.99 a movie! For PG people- not porno! Even most high end properties rarely charge more than 7-9 dollars a movie. Front desk clerk was not rude, but was far from helpful either. She failed to tell us that the only working ice machine on the property was in the restaurant. A secret that she failed to share with many other guests as well. We were not alone in our search. Forget the breakfast buffet. The restaurant was so filthy that we did not even stay long enough to take a look at the food. There are more than a few properties in the general vicinity in the same price range or slightly higher that, although they are a little older, are clean, convenient and in good repair. Do your homework, or if you are booking last minute like we did, consider spending a little more or opting for a hotel a little farther away from the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “IF THE ROOM HAD BEEN FREE, I WOULD HAVE STILL PAID TOO MUCH”
Reviews.Author: tntraveler71
Reviews.Content: NASTY, NASTY, NASTY. Sheets had a "sticky" feeling! Toilet did not flush! Outdoor walkway flooring was rotted. Hotel is in horrible state of disrepair. CHECKED OUT AFTER SIX HOURS

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: blabla08
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel a few years ago. Experience overall it was ok. Need some improvements by replacing the carpet. Price was ok; I paid lower prices in other places in Fl, including full kitchen. The only problem was the keys, it was so humid that we needed to change often, but overall, it was a nice stay. Staff was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ploeg8393
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here, no matter how good of a deal. I booked it but i never got in my room since my card didn't work. I told the front desk and they sent a serviceman...who never got there. I cancelled my stay and left.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thomscollins
Reviews.Content: My friend had reserved 5 rooms a couple of month's ago, so our car club could attend the Mopar car show at Old Town. When I went to the check in desk, the lady acted as if I was bothering her, and another lady behind the desk stepped up and asked if she could help. The reserved price was $49.99. No problem. Was told the pool is shut down because someone did a "no no" in it. And the ice machines aren't working, so if we need ice, we have to come to the front desk. So we make our way to our room. Open the door, smells heavily of cleaning products, kind of overwhelming, so I left the door open to let it air out a little. The bathroom had peeling paint on the ceiling and walls. Some fell down in my husband's hair while he was showering!!! Yuk!!! There were also spots of black, possibly mold? The beds were horrible. I may as well have slept on the sidewalk that night. The tv also didn't work correctly. Most of the channels had lines going through them, and a crackling sound out of the speakers every so often. Well, talking to our friends the next morning, they said they had only paid $39.99!!! Now, we are at the same place, why such a difference in price. This is not a place that I will return to. While it was nice being directly next door to Old Town, it's not worth the peeling paint, half working tv, and the un-caring actions of the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “go any place else”
Reviews.Author: brithe420guy
Reviews.Content: this place was a dump!!!!! By all means i"m not picky at all but i can honestly say this may have been the worse hotel i've ever seen.lets just start with the room. Dirty can't even sum it up. My 4 year old found a small bag of what looked to be crack in the bathroom dried blood on the sheets, mold in the bath room, and a dirty tampon behind the tv. next we went to the play ground and it looked dangerious boards missing on walk ways, nails sticking out of the wood and alot of broken glass in the sand. so off to the pool we went. even worse looks as if its never been cleaned it was so so green at the bottom u slipped every time you touched it and the tiki bar was closed.long story short we left after maybe 4hrs and went some place rite down the street and it was 100 times better and the only a few dollars more a night. oh and dont eat at there little buffet either we got so sick all 4 of us

Reviews.Title: “2 rooms and left after 10 min's. Bedbugs on pillow!”
Reviews.Author: eliza0104
Reviews.Content: My husband I arrived w/ our two exhausted toddlers. We were traveling through to Fort Myers and wanted to stop for the night. We arrived at midnight. The first room had not been cleaned. Chip bags in the trash, bed was not made and there was pizza flyers on the ground. We moved to another room. This room "appreared" 'to be cleaned. My son plopped on the bed and I moved one of the three pillows to the night stand. I thought I saw lint on the pillow and went to flick it off, but it was moving. A little bedbug moving all around that pillow. I wanted to pull back the comforter, but I didn't have the courage. Exhausted from driving 10 hours already, we powered on and immediately left that hotel. No way was I letting my family sleep in a hotel w/ bedbugs. I wouldn't stay here if you paid me!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad..”
Reviews.Author: salukisue
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, but we had two double beds and we are a married couple. Refrigerator and microwave were nice. T.V. worked. Bathroom was clean. We were in a room on the first floor, very near the pool. Pool was warm. The Tiki bar was not open while we were there. Beware the pushy lady in the lobby trying to get you to look at time shares. Also, do not order from the pizza places that put fliers under the room door. They are fakes and will take your credit card info. This is common in the Orlando/Kissimmee area. Good location. Ok for our one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “A motel”
Reviews.Author: CSRE
Reviews.Content: I have been in orlando many many times and this is by far one of the worst places i've stayed at. Overall the place is not bad but it is not a hotel, it is a plain and simple Motel, and for that price ($50-70 per night) you can get a better place to stay for sure. Orlando, and even the irlo bronsos (if you wanna stay in that area) is crowded with hotel so i would stay somewhere else. Most rooms are dated and smelly, beds are not comfy, pillows are a nightmare, it is quite noisy, tv has limited channels and the worst (at least for me) there is no internet connection (no a port, no wifi, no nothig) so we had to park at the Holiday inn parking lot to use the computer. We checked out at the second night even though we had 2 more nights paid in advance (we used priceline). I guess it depends on how picky you are and on what things are important for you in a place to stay. I would never stay here again nor recommend it to nobody

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Room”
Reviews.Author: GidgetTexas
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we came prepared with frebreeze, air purifier, cleaning supplies, our own bed linens as well as pillow top comforter for sleeping. The only thing we used was the pillow top comforter for the bed. We were there 8 days and the hotel room was perfect. The carpet was new, room was clean, we had a microwave and refrigerator, the bathroom was spotless, check in and check out was effortless and the people working there were very nice and helpful. They even allowed us to check in early. Perfect location for eating and grocery shopping. No complaints here. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: luna_g
Reviews.Content: This hotel/motel is horrible! We tried three different rooms in three different buildings and they were all terrible. It is in desperate need of a paint job, the door knobs are rusty, the stairs are deteriorating, the rooms smell of mildew and mold, HUGE gaps under the entrance doors let bugs in, two of the three rooms we tried had chain locks that were snapped in two, very tiny bathrooms with mildew floor tiles, and the beds felt like army issue. TERRIBLE! After the third room we cancelled our reservation and stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel? A True Joke!”
Reviews.Author: thibbmd
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 10 people traveling and with gas prices we chose to stay at this property during our 8 day vacation in Florida. When we checked in the staff was nice and helpful, but needless to say when you finish reading this comment you will soon realize that, that is the only good thing I can say about this property. The lobby was decent needs some updating... When we got to the second floor balcony going to our room we realized that the floor beneath use was rotten and had multiple holes and weak spots in it, spanning from one end of the property to the other! Our door looked as if it had not been painted since the day the property was opened. Our room walls had scratches, mold, and scuff marks from top to bottom, the ceiling was dropping down from the light area. Fortunally we brought our own cleaning supplies, cleaned the bathroom, the cleaing cloth was black, the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling and there was a red clay substance in the corner of the bathroom. mold from to to bottom, the shower had mold on the ceiling. There was no reason to even utilize the bathroom because you would leave more dirty than when you entered. You truly get what you pay for. So think twice and book at another property!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: SandmanGStefani24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because the rate was lower than anything else in the area, and the website photos looked promising. I was very sorry I didn't spend just a little more and stay elsewhere. The lobby was decent, but the staff was slow at check-in. The real problems though, started when I went to my room. The hotel as a whole is way past its prime. The walls in my room were beat up, the walpaper in the bathroom was peeling, revealing mold underneath. The toilet was loose and if you leaned it would lean with you. The balcony between the rooms and the stairway/elevators sagged alarmingly when I dared place my entire 145 lbs onto it. I would hate to think what more weight would do! The much-touted TikiBar poolside was merely a bamboo shack which was closed, and didn't look like it had been open for a long time, something the webside failed to mention. The area of town was also less than appealing, and didn't encourage walking around to explore much. I was also approached by a local "merchant" shall we say, trying to sell me something I wasn't interested in. While I did have HBO, I only had about 12 channels total, and luckily I had my cell phone, or I would have been charged $1.50 per local call, and all but the 1st floor ice makers were broken. The beds were small and there was a nice little sign telling me if anything came up missing I would be charged. The arcade was about the size of a tool/utility room, and had about 3 old video games in it. I could go on, but I'm sure you get the point. You get what you pay for, and I got it on this trip. It isn't too much more to stay elsewhere, or if visiting Disney, stay onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and hard beds”
Reviews.Author: lovinit05
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday afternoon. The front desk was nice and courteous. No problems there. When we walked into the room, the smell overwhelmed us. It smelled like it has been locked up for years. It smelled very musty. Luckily, we brought a candle to keep the smell somewhat down. When we first walked in, the room didn't look so bad. Boy, was I wrong! You could see the dust around some of the furniture on the floor. When I went to put my shoes by the safe, I noticed a big dead bug! On the bathroom sink there were ants crawling all around the edge of it. In the bathroom itself, the floor looked dirty and nasty, especially around the molding. I don't know what it was but it was red. The toilet seat was still dirty. I didn't walk around the room with no shoes on. I wore my sandels at all times. When it was time to sleep, we hardly got any sleep! The beds were too hard and very uncomfortable. The sheets were too short for the bed too. When we got back from Disney World, the maids had come into our room and cleaned it up some. The beds were made, they gave us extra coffee and shampoo. Well, that night wasn't any better. It was worse. Around 2am, the neighbor next to us was yelling so loud. Cussing and constantly slamming the door. By 3am, we called the front desk to complain about it. They said they will send someone to their room to quiet them down. We didn't hear another peep. We finally fell asleep (of course, a restless sleep). By morning, we were ready to get out. Ready to come home to our own beds. When it was time to check out, the Front Desk Supervisor never asked how our stay was. He didn't let us voice our concerns of the room or service. Where was the hospitality??

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and hard beds”
Reviews.Author: katescratch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was only $35 a night but when we walked in it smelled so bad, like wet airconditioner/yuk. Beds were so hard to sleep on and the sheet over the bed did not fit and would come off every night and ball up around me. Clean bathroom. Looked like new tile surround. Did have a on site breakfast buffet for 3.99 per adult and kids ate free. It was good and many choices. The pool was nice but the play ground is old and rotting with lots of ants. Free shuttle to Disney World was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “ewwwwwwww”
Reviews.Author: Ang68
Reviews.Content: Checked in and out the same day. This place is nasty! Stained carpets, smelly, paint peeling off the wall, mold and scum in the tub, ants, rusty broken safe, God knows what the beds were like. It was the worst place I've ever seen. We ended up in Orlado in a nice CLEAN room and shower. It would have ruined my vacation if i was stuck there. STAY AWAY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rockxxstar
Reviews.Content: The Days inn looked ok from the out side. My sister and I walked in the room and it smelled like cat urine. There was a large group of us staying there...we pretty much threw our bags in the rooms and went out for dinner. but once we got back, we noticed it wasnt ok. It was HORRIBLE!!!! i hate sleeping under the blankets in hotels as it is, but this room skeeved me out alot..so i got under the sheets and just prayed that nothing would touch me while i slept. everything was fine until the morning. they shower was pretty nasty. and there were burns in the rug. i noticed a little bug crawling on my toothbrush and flicked it off not thinking it was anything. then my sister informed me there were bugs all over her bed!! they were everywhere!!!! and there was a roach in the shower. thank god we noticed after we took one! some other people we traveled with had bugs by their coffee pots. and more bugs in their beds. two people that shared a room had to get a different room because the floor was soaking wet. the tiki bar was leaking really bad. the pool did not look clean at all. a couple of people had problems opening their doors and with their tv's. when i was in my room, all the lights were unplugged. i was bit a couple of times by the bugs and was itchy all day. personally i would NEVER stay there again. it is very cheap but not worth it at all. i wouldnt stay there if it was free!! and i can say on behalf of the group i was with, none of them would ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvseward59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights in March 2008. I was hestitant at first because of all the crap that eveyone has put on here about this particular property but if you look at the dates they were mostly back in 2005 so I gave it a chance. It was above and beyond what I expected. It is located in the best of places for those going to the amusement parks. It is right beside Old Town which I did not even have a chance to go see but it seemed cool enough. The room was really nice. All the channels worked on my tv. The air was really quite and was COLD. Our beds were nice and comfy after a LONG day at Disney. The staff was great. They gave us ice for our cooler everyday and was just really great. I woudl HIGHLY reccommend this hotel to anyone . We stayed in room 2026 and our friends in 2024 and they were both very nice. So if you wanna stay and be in a nice room just request one of those rooms. They are supurb. Anyone going to Disney would do well by staying here. Cant say enough postive about it. Hope this puts some minds at ease as this is a safe and nice clean place.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: djbearont
Reviews.Content: The room was clean if a bit spartan. Not all the channels were available on the tv as advertised. Noise from the road was loud. Yet room was clean and no real surprises. Shuttle to theme parks was good. I would stay there again. Breakfast buffet was good value.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ctxguy
Reviews.Content: My fiance & I were visiting Disney World for our annual winter vacation. I booked this hotel because it was cheap, we checked out after the first night & went to a different hotel. The staff seemed nice, but the rooms smelled like mildew & the beds felt like you were sleeping on just a box spring. If you want to find a cheap hotel & not sleep this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God Horrible!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ledstewart
Reviews.Content: This was the worst ever. Not even for the price was this okay. We didn't expect much, and we got even less. There were no functioning ice machines, the room smelled of mold/mildew, the paint was peeling in large sections from the wall, the drawers of the chest were broken and laying there useless, there was human nasal discharge on the wall by the bed, the carpet felt sticky and filthy, the room air conditioner is not drained properly, so the walk to the room is over puddles of water. We left early, just couldn't take it any further.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Irishtravellerlaois
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and from the website it looked pretty ok. The website is very deceptive as this is the most horrible hotel my husband and I have ever stayed in. Dirty, smelly, all other reviews have said it all so I have nothing more to add. We originally checked in for 3 nights, we stayed 1, checked out the next day and RAN to the Quality Suites next door which was a much more pleasant expierience. Do not stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for sleeping, low price, but expect anything.”
Reviews.Author: poyitoh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through expedia because it was $29 a night. I am a backpacker so the priority here was low price above all and they included shuttles to the parks in orlando. After reading some reviews I got a bit concerned, though others were recomforting so I assumed it was a bit of luck with the rooms and service. The Hotel The hotel looks old and needs a lot of maintenance, the same for the rooms, which also need deeper cleaning, I guess daily cleaning is not performed throughly. The Room Smells like a motel i guess this is standard in old carpet rooms. Since our arrival there were yellow greasse drops on the bathroom door, the wallpaper is peeled off and stained, so is the carpet. The bed was fine, clean sheets and pillow (as far as we could see). The tv works with about 20 channels. The coffe maker was broken. The towells look really old, but clean, except for the last day, one came with hairs. The pool I guess this is the best part of the hotel, very nice with a deep area. but open only until 11pm. Area Old Town Kissimmee is a small town, looks like a small town and you should not expect more. Lots of Souvenir Shops and the Old Town street has Fair-Like rides and attractions, you can drink beer along that street. We found a nice Pub with live music on the weekends, don't remember the name but is big... a live rock band perfomed really good on friday(Red Hot, Incubus, etc). Restaurants in walking distance and City Bus to Walt Disney World accors the street ($1.50us) The Shuttles I crossed emails wit the GM of the hotel before arrival and I was told there were 3 shutles in the morning and 3 in the afternoon for ALL parks. Once I got there found out there's only one ONE in the morning and ONE in the afternoon, except for Magic Kingdom. The shutles are from a different company, so the customer service is just acceptable. Late Pickups; a shutle didn't show up so we had to wait for more than an hour and take a taxi, luckily the hotel reimbursed it; Schedule changes with no advise, so we showed at the front desk at 11am but the shuttle changed the schedule to 9am the previous day, so of course, we missed it. Once the trip from Universal to the hotel took us 2 hours, the driver didn't know the way, got lost and was unfriendly with the people. The shuttles stop at many hotels before the parks and on the way back and only once we were the first to be dropped, so expect a 30min to 90min ride. The City Bus passes in front of the hotel and brings you to Disney central Station in 30 min for $1.50, from there you take free the Disney Monorail to any Disney Park. We found this to be the most convenient. The Breakfast Buffet It's 3,99 plus tax plus the beverages. Well, it's a buffet, eggs, one kind of bread, one kind of sausage, one kind of cereal, and awfull muffins. For the same price you get a way better breakfast buffet at La Ponderosa, which is within 5 minutes walking distance, and next to a nice souvenir shop. Cleanliness If you care about the cleanliness of a hotel, spend some more and go to a better one. I cared mostly about budget so I decided to stay here, but will never come back. Even though it's only for sleeping, it does not fell comfortable. So next time I wanna stay budget I'll go for a 3 star at least and rent a car... cuz in shuttles we wasted at least 3 hours per day... plus the no-show! One more advise, in Kissimmee most hotels are budget and it's a Budget-Turist town, so they'll try to go cheap on you and to get you to buy useless stuff... when apparently there's no catch, you end up caught. I thought I would bypass all the things I read in the reviews, but they made my vacation a hassle. On the last day we rceived a letter stating that the carpet was to be cleaned, and eventhough they trusted the cleaning company we should store our value goods in the safe... WTF? If you wanna stay budget think about this... are you going to Hawaii... or to Disney? The answer might ruin the Magic or the Dreams Come True thing. Cheers from Canada!

Reviews.Title: “I was deceived and grossed out!”
Reviews.Author: Aloha52153
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. I was told a price of $44.95 when I reserved but charged $ 59.95 plus this tax, that tax and an occupancy fee at checkout. It came to over $70 for a nasty room. They also refused to honor a coupon that they should have honored. It wasn't expired, wasn't a holiday weekend just a regular day. I spent 2 days here and smelled cat urine for both days. When I tried to get back in my room the key wouldn't work. After a long day at Disney the last thing I needed was to have to go have it reprogrammed. They said I must have put it next to my cell phone. Well they reprogrammed both my key and my husbands and when he got it back he placed it on the bureau. A little while later he took it to go to the car and on his return it did not work again. I guess the cell phone must have visited it! Also skip the breakfast buffet. I found out why no one else was there eating, nothing tasted good. Do yourself a favor and don't stay here, it's worn out , dirty and they may deceive you with the price as they did me. I wish I read the reviews on this site before I went.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but might not recommend to your best friend”
Reviews.Author: mtnsunshne
Reviews.Content: Our family (four kids, husband and self) stayed at this hotel on our last evening of an 8 day Florida vacation. It was okay. The check-in process was fine. It was nice of the desk clerk to put us real close to the pool. The property itself is a very tired looking Days Inn who has seen better days of vacationing families. It could really use a freshing up on everything...paint and carpet especially. The vending machines & ice machines were not working which required going to the other building to the front desk to get it which was a minor inconvenience. I probably would not stay here again just because of it's run down appearance and questionable cleanliness. The buffet breakfast was also just ok. While a cheap price, the quality and variety beyond cold cereal and scrambled eggs left me a little hungry. There was a nice flea market across the street with very inexpensive souveniors and dunkin donuts and checkers were also close by for quick food runs.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Decent”
Reviews.Author: VENTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights at this hotel, and i have to say that for the price i payed i have no complains. The clerk at the reception treated us, me and my girlfriend well at the moment of our arrival that was really late at night, the room was clean and everything worked just fine. The only thing dirty in the room was the carpet, that truly needs to be replaced, but the rest was ok. The breakfast was really cheap, and was abundant. We had our room cleaned everyday and never lost anything, even my laptop wich i forgot over the bed one day. It is a hotel for sleep not for hang around, beacause the pool area is really basic and with so many things to do in kissimmee and orlando you don´t want to spend your day there. Don´t expect luxury or great accomodations, it is just a room for sleep. We used to go out early in the morning and come back late at night to rest.

Reviews.Title: “Price was great”
Reviews.Author: Dejavu131
Reviews.Content: In my opinion checking in to the hotel was wonderful. The service was quick. We arrived at 12:15pm and to our surprise we didnt have to wait till 4:00pm to get a room. I guess its because there were many rooms available. When i made the reservations back in January for the first two weeks of July, I declinded paying extra for the microfridge in our roooms. But for some reason the hotel gave us a room with microfridge. Thanks Days Inn. Tip # 1 If you plan on using shuttle services make sure you're on time cause the buses fill up quickly. Thankfully Days Inn is the second hotel picked up from the lane 52 Bus Company... And if you end up being one of those unfortunate people that has to stand during your trip to Magic Kingdom, please remember that the bus services are FREE. If you have a problem with that then just rent a car. Tip # 2 The Mircofridge is a good thing to have in the room. A little side note most of the vending machines in the hotel are sold out. I dont thnk they replensh frequently. Tip # 3 The Laundry room gets hot and the coin machine was an issue when i was staying there. Just go to the front desk get change and then wash the clothes. The Bottom dryers work great. Theirs one top dryer that the door opens when drying if you must use that dryer make sure you have tape to keep the door closed. Tip # 4 Across the street to the right theres a flea market great for souvenior shopping. Tip # 5 We didn't see this supermarket until our 5th day but theirs a PUBLIX across the street where the Dunkin donuts is. Right Behind it. Tip # 6 The safari cafateria is great and affordable. all you can eat for 3.99 and 1.25 for drinks. Now thats a bargain!!! The only thing that i have to complain about is the heated pool. We're in the summer why would we want to swim in warm water. Thanks Days Inn for a wonderful 2 weeks...

Reviews.Title: “Not fit for humans nor their pets”
Reviews.Author: gtn8fan
Reviews.Content: After being checked in for only 23 minutes, my wife and I knew we had made a huge mistake. The room smelled of stale urine, the carpetting was bunched up and stained, the furniture appeared as though it were purchased at a garage sale, the bathroom light was flickering,and there were what looked dead roaches within the actual light fixture. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone that values their health and personal safety.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: FondduLac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2007. Don't stay here!! The rooms were in need of some updating. The carpeting was bumpy, the outside doors were in need of paint, the beds were lumpy (a moth flew out of our bed), the faucets were old on the sink and need replacing, the shower was ok. There were chunks of drywall missing in places, the bathroom door was hard to open or close. The pool was questionable as far was what chemicals were or were not in it. The worst part was the front desk staff. Unfriendly, not helpful at all. There also was a guy hustling everyone that came into the lobby to get discounted Disney tickets if you go with him to see his condos. NO WAY! This is also on a busy street with hotel upon hotel. We were booked only 1 night here after leaving the Port Orleans Riverside (Disney property) en route to the Gulf. Don't spend your money here please.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Daze Inn”
Reviews.Author: srqnnana
Reviews.Content: Run, do not walk, to another hotel!! We booked this hotel directly because we needed a pet friendly room since we were traveling with our two dogs and were charged an extra $40.00 for them. I was afraid to let them sleep on the carpeting that is how filthy and moldy it was. So, they slept on the beds with us. We cancelled a room at the La Quinta, a little further away due to our cousins and family staying at this hotel. They experienced even worse with their room keys not working at a late hour and holding sleeping children in their arms. It was all just a nightmare, and we wanted to just go home to our own house and bed!! We even checked out a day ahead because we did not want to sleep there another night. (neither did the dogs)!!! Traveler Beware!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Book you own reservations & don't stay at a Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: WonderWomanPensacola
Reviews.Content: Our hotel for my family's vacation was booked and payed for at least 7-8 weeks prior to our vacation. When we arrived at our hotel to check in, they had no reservation for my family. They were rude to me when I asked them to check with hotels.com. Once they established we did have reservations (45 mins later)they never once appologized or showed any concern for our inconvenience. The second night my famil & I came in from one of the Disney parks very late. As we went to take showers I noticed the cleaning crew only left 2 towels & wash rags.I called to the front desk and he stated that they had no one available to bring me extra towels. He suggested I come to the front desk to pick them up. Now the front desk was several buildings away. (Not in walking distance at 11:30 p.m.) I argued with him to find someone to bring me 2 more towels. The third night we came in from another Disney park and again very late. As we tried to get into our hotel the key would not work. They had changed the locks. I had to get back in my car and drive to the front dest to get new keys. Again, no concern for my inconvenience. I phoned Hotels.com to voice my problems with Days Inn and was told "oh, well sorry for that. You can go to TripAdvisor.com and write what happened". So here is my story of our family vacation for 2007.

Reviews.Title: “A Disaster!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1-2-Explore
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect example of why you should NEVER book a hotel over the Internet! After searching for over half an hour to find the hotel (whose sign was hanging upside down and unlit because it had never been fixed after the hurricane 3 months prior), my husband and I walked in to find 3 couples before us complaining that the hotel was overbooked and were being sent away (although they had reservation confirmations), as well as another couple complaining that their NEW room's toilet was full of waste and overflowing on the floor....their first room's door wouldn't shut, was dirty and smelly with no heat. We were told that they had no room to give us and that we would have to find another hotel which they would pay for (providing it was the same cost as the room we booked). This being the week of New Year's Eve was not a simple task. After a lot of shouting from all couples, the police were finally called and the manager (who the staff couldn't seem to reach) was finally contacted. We spent the better part of the night searching for another hotel (as we arrived after 10 PM). At 3 AM we finally found another hotel that was far away but well worth the journey. However, when we tried to get Days Inn to pay for the room (as they promised) they refused. Sufficed to say, had I not made a big scene, and had my husband not told the man that I wouldn't stop until they reinbursed us, I would still be awaiting that reinbursement. My advice: Stay Away. Stay Far Far Away!!

Reviews.Title: “One Nasty Cheap Days Inn, Rude Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: mustangmustanger
Reviews.Content: Came into Kissimmee on May 24 late had my son call to see if rooms were available had a coupon book listed for 32.95 said no need to reserve plenty of rooms, I know why now.... Got in they said I needed a reservation for the room (was not stated in coupon book) I needed 2 nights 2nd night stated in coupon 44.95 they said It would be 69.95 but no restrictions in coupon book on Memorial day weekend. Said they would honor 32.95 for 1 night signed sheet went to the nasty room. Scum all over walls, mold behind sink, light in bathroom worked when it wanted to, coffee maker missing the lid and scum inside where you pour the water(didn't use) all handles missing or hanging off of dresser, WET CARPET and a hole in the blanket on the bed the size of a medium size dog. I threw blanket and spread in floor and used my bedding to cover up the nasty bed. I felt so nasty when I left... complained of wet carpet and coffee maker never noticed the blanket until midnight they didn't offer to move me to another room maybe because all rooms were bad I may have found more wrong with the next one. At check out next morning they had a rate on the sheet that was not what was on the coupon I got the book they asked me if I had the book at check in and I said yes. He threw his hands in the air huffed and puffed and eventually changed the rate I said it was not my fault the people working last night didn't know what they were doing. I told him the room was nasty and I was never staying there again and he yelled at me why did you stay here to begin with. I told him I would tell everyone I pass on the way out to not stay here it is nasty. They said they would give me a credit of 1/2 the room and rate to 32.95 but failed to tell me they would take taxes from the 32.95 So just got 1/2 room price after complaint to main Days Inn and several weeks of waiting. Never stay here may be close but drive farther for better class of rooms. I would rate this -5 totally gross. Also don't eat at their restaurant it is nasty also hard donuts, rubber pancakes, only thing I had good was fruit how can you screw that up???

Reviews.Title: “Just got back from 5 nights at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tbgb12345
Reviews.Content: My 20 year old daughter and I just returned from spending 5 nights at this hotel. No real problems-no smells, no dirt, no blood, good housekeeping, good airconditioning, shower, bathroom and sink worked fine. My only worry was the outdoor walkway (we were on the 3rd floor) to our room seemed a little "spongy" and as if there might have been holes under the carpet. Good value for the price. We only slept and showered there, so weren't too concerned about the few TV channels there were. The location was fantastic. Did not try the buffet or listen to the pitches for time shares. Front desk was helpful when needed.

Reviews.Title: “So close, but so gross!”
Reviews.Author: secondgrademom
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the promo price of $29 a night. It was the off season and my tavel rewards partner had a deal. I am very reasonable about my expectations. This isn't the Mariott, Sheraton or Hilton. The location was 5 minutes from Disney- Yeah! We only planned to use the hotel to crash at night. All I needed was a clean room and bathroom. When we got to our room, both beds were soiled. There were drops of blood in one bed and lots of hair in the other bed, including pubic hair. GROSS! It was so late and we were so tired, we closed up the bedding and spread beach blankets on the bed. The next morning we called the front desk for all new linens and blankets. Upon returning from Disney that night the linens and blankets were the same and it was after midnight. We opted for the beach blanket idea again. The next morning I called again. Take 2. We got in on night #3 to the same dirty beds. I called the manager at 11:30pm. She was polite and sent security over with clean sheets, but no clean blankets. We were too skeeved to get in the beds and just used our beach blankets again. I did leave my camera battery in the room and they had it waiting for me at the front desk on the way to the airport. They could have kept it or thrown it away. There was also a nice welcome package upon arrival with many necesstities: tylenol, cold medicine, pepto for kids, gum, etc. The staff was pleasant and the location was great. Unfortunately the soiled beds were such a turnoff. A clean bed and room was all I expected for my money. This hotel is a 4 sun rarting as well. It didn't live up to that.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointer”
Reviews.Author: CharliePR
Reviews.Content: When I looked up this hotel at the Days Inn Website, I was impressed to book a stay in this because it was advertised as a 5 Sunburst Property, thats the company rating suposed to be outstanding. I've stayed in other Days Inn with lower or none Sunburst rating that were far superior to this one. The furniture and bedding was worn out, It was moldy, and it didnt look anything like the pictures on the website. It did serve it purpose for less than 30 bucks a night I suppose I got my money's worth, However I consider decieving the advertisement They have in the website.

Reviews.Title: “it's a good hotel for 35 dollars per night”
Reviews.Author: charchelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at days inn for 4 nights and all i can say is that this is a good hotel for a very cheap price, we payed 35 dollars a night plus tax for 1 room 2 bedrooms. before we checked in this hotel i read reviews here on tripadvisor and i got scared because some reviews said that they found some insects(bed bugs) in their room, but yeah i found 1 bug but thats it, our room was always clean and the bathroom was clean, though it is not a 5 star hotel so dont expect too much when you pay cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel before you pay!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine08753
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel online with a non-refundable payment in full BEFORE I read reviews on Tripadvisor. It was very inexpensive and very close to Disney World. Once I read the online reviews I was horrified and afraid of what I would find in my room. We had a room on the top floor seperate from the main building and while our room needed paint and new carpeting, we did not have the problems described by other travelers. In 5 nights I did not see any bugs and our sheets and pillows appeared to be brand new and very, very white and clean. The toilet and the sink worked fine. There were a lot of low life people staying there due to the price. I never went to the pool as I was visiting friends elsewhere. I would not stay there again as I never slept the first 2 nights because of what I had read on this website. I spoke with another traveler in the hotel lobby who had the problems described online and was desperate to get her money back but they would not do that.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Stay At The Days Inn!”
Reviews.Author: HigherEd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Days Inn Maingate East for a professional conference, and on the last day I was there I keyed in to my room to find that I had been ROBBED. Long story short, some of my clothing, plus my $1000 LAPTOP, had been stolen. After the police left, I asked for a refund for my stay and the hotel staff refused. So in the end, I lost $1000 plus the rate of my three days - NO COMPENSATION FROM THEM WHATSOEVER! Not even free days of stay at a later date and different location! THIS WAS AN AWFUL EXPERIENCE, PLEASE THINK OF YOUR SAFETY!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs... Please Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ann-from-Michigan
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for three nights 1/27/07 thru 1/30/07 it seemed like an OK place especially for the price (don't be fooled like us). The first night we were exhausted put our things in our room and went to supper returned to the hotel late and put our 3 year old to bed watched a little TV then went to sleep ourselves. The next morning we were getting ready for our day at Disney I pulled back the blanket on the bed my baby slept in and there were bed bugs!!! I thought I was going to be sick my husband began to look around the headboard and mattresses they were all over. We had seen a special about a year ago on Dateline so we could tell what they were. I called the front desk they offered to change our room and I explained all we wanted was to leave. I went and checked us out and asked for a refund which was given. However the manager said this was the first she had heard of such a thing this was interesting because while I was at the front desk housekeeping went to our room and told my husband these were indeed bed bugs and it was quite obvious it was not her first encounter. PLEASE JUST STAY AWAY, YOU DON'T WANT TO BRING THESE THINGS HOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: miststuff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was the cheapest available ... what a huge mistake! To begin with the staff were extremely rude, probably because they are so tired of the dump and complaints and hearing about it. The rooms, urgh! Disgusting is an understatement, dirty and I mean everywhere from the carpets to the beds and bathroom. There were nasty bugs all in the room, you sit on the toilet and cringe as they crawl in the crevices like lemmings in the bathroom. The mold is awful, the AC doesn't work right and the sheets don't seem washed. You look closely enough and you'll find trash behind and around the furniture including used kleenex and other things I just don't want to mention. The breakfast buffet is gross, go up the road to Ponderosa for something edible. The only nice thing about the hotel is the pool and tiki bar, but it doesn't even come close to making up for all it's downfalls. Please please just stay away and go to one of the many inexpensive hotels close by.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable Friendly Accomodations!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler327
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant, clean, average hotel for the rate. We had a very clean room. The front desk staff was very friendly and I might say very busy at our check-in time, He was on the phone with another guest, giving another driving directions, telling the guest next in line after us that he would be right with them, while checking us in all at the same time. We were very impressed how he was handling the stress. I commented to him that, "wow your really tied up eh? he said no worries and handed us two drink vouchers for the "Tiki Bar" maybe I looked stressed to him. He also explained in detail about the all-you-can-eat Breakfast Buffet price,menu,etc. We didn't get to experience the Buffet because of the long line and we were pressed for time. But however we will book there again for future travel needs. Right next door to "Old Town" shopping ,dinning. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Choose the DI Maingate East Only if there is no other choice”
Reviews.Author: CDN03030303
Reviews.Content: The price does not provide a sufficient justification for staying at this hotel (which is actually a motel). The place clearly has persistant mold problems. The mold in the bathroom ceiling will never go away; the problem is made worse by the fact that the bathroom fan that does not work. The air conditioners do not sufficiently circulate enough air throughout the room to cool down the room, or introduce fresh air. The sheets were torn and stained. Should have been replaced. The carpets were stained. The ONLY good thing about this place is the hotel staff who are friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Please Do NOT stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I have stayed at many Days Inn locations throughout my life and I have always found the hotels to be comfortable, clean, and cheap. We recently took a vacation to Walt Disney World (June 28, 2006) and decided to stay off the property. I looked at several different hotels and decided on the Days Inn because I receive a special discount and never had a problem with them. I read some of the online reviews, and to be honest, didn't really think what some people said was true. I have often read reviews and found for myself that I was completely satisfied. Well, not with the Days Inn Maingate East. IT WAS HORRIBLE! The room smelled musty, the lights had burnt out bulbs that were never changed, the sheets had hairs on them and didn't even fit the bed so our feet touched the gross mattress, there were marks all over the door, walls, and ceiling, the bathroom light didn't always work, the tub was dirty, and the silver circle thing below the spout was hanging off. The pictures they show online cannot be a room at this hotel. The beds were falling apart and the bedspreads and drapes were disgusting. Now, I understand that the rates are cheap and I wasn't expecting a five-star hotel. HOWEVER, there is a standard of cleanliness that all hotels should have. This one did not. They moved us near the pool and it was loud, kids were knocking on our door, and there was garbage all over the grounds. The hotel offered a shuttle service to Walt Disney World, but you had only one time to leave each day, the service was not good and the buses were poorly maintained. We checked out early because it was so bad and stayed at the Quality Suites next door. It was obviously more expensive, but it was very clean and well-maintained. I would recommend it. Again, I didn't really think what people were saying was the truth, but please take it from me, this hotel was no good and there are plenty of other nice hotels for cheap in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great, minimal conditions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hard bed full size beds only, flat pillows, chipping paint, stained ceilings and carpets and walls, gaps in door jams, stained towels, toilet wouldn't flush. Inroom safe was a joke. Charge for extra towels. Shuttle was overcrowded (standing room only) with other stops and left at 7:30 every morning only. None of the drivers spoke English and were very vague about any destination. Nice pool, although it is shared with another hotel and is always crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER stay here again”
Reviews.Author: FloridaPixie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after getting a low special rate online ($33 per night). Location was a strong selling point, but I also thought the rooms looked okay online. Was I ever wrong! There were several factors which made this a pretty crappy lodging experience: 1. The room felt kind of moldy and damp due to the extremely loud air conditioner. 2. The bathroom was rusty, damp, and nasty. There was a slight ring around the toilet when we checked in, so I am guessing that it was missed by the housekeeper. 3. The bedspreads were shabby and dirty looking. 4. The bottom bed sheet kept shifting (it wasn't fitted), exposing a dirty, tired looking mattress (gross!) 5. My socks were filthy after walking around on the floor. 6. The pool doesn't appear to have "pool hours," so it was completely packed and extremely loud until very, very late. Our room was poolside. I will never stay here again. Vacation time is too precious to spend in a nasty, low quality hotel like this Days Inn. Spend a little extra and find somewhere better for you and your family.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn not that bad”
Reviews.Author: lizgordaneer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Days Inn in Kissimmee Florida. Was a little worried with all the bad reviews. The Days Inn was not that bad. The rooms were clean and showers worked just fine. We found the staff very friendly and co-operative. Days Inn is centrally located. Just steps to Old Town with a wonderful car rally on Friday and Saturday nights and some very interesting shops. We rented a car so didn't have to rely on the shuttle. Would not recommend the breakfast at Days Inn. Go across the road to the Sizzlin Grill. Much better and the same price $3.99. The buffet at Sizzlin Grill is very good as well and they usually give you a 10% off coupon if you want to return. Days Inn is a strictly budget motel so don't go looking for 5 star accomodations when its a 2 star. If you want somewhere to shower and lay your head its a good deal and very comfortable. Elizabeth,. Mississauga, Canada

Reviews.Title: “SunDAYS INN Bloody SunDAYS INN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OMG - where to start? <cracks knuckles> So we arrive and check in, and are immediately hit with the Disney information lady trying to get us to commit to going to a condo presentation for $70 park money. We politely decline several times and walk over to the room. Once inside the room, (PU - musty stink) the first thing we do is sit on the beds, which are about as comfortable as concrete slabs. Next I go to get a kleenex and the wall dispenser comes out of the wall. Looking down I notice that there seems to be a convention of ants in the sink. Next, the bathroom gets a look and there is either a) feces on the wall, or b) someone was waiving a hershey bar around while in there. After a while, I attempt to turn omn the TV and the TV box is damaged to the point where only the remote turns it on. We get about 10 channels of which only 3 do not have interference so bad that it is unwatchable - HBO, The Spanish channel and a channel with just a pic of Disnay and no sound. My Girlfriend goes to take a shower next and one of the towels has blood stains all over it. We complain about the towel and get 2 fresh ones, but no apology and no effort to remove said towel. Wonderful! Are we on TV?? This has to be a joke - but it gets worse. When we got to bed, I try and set the alarm only to discover that the underside is covered in some sort of unidentified sticky substance - eww, eww and EWW! The next day we come back from the parks and turn the bed down to discover 3 baseball sized blood smears on the top sheet and trace amounts on the bottom. What kind of ritual sacrifice had been going on in here? I rip off said covers and canabilize the ones from the other bed. The next morning it's complain to Management time again and they promise that they will clean our room top to bottom for us. Lo and Behold when we return the bottom sheet is exactly the same, doody still resides on the wall and we are once again disgusted beyond belief. Moving onto the "free" shuttle service aspect - the Omni Tours busses were rolling junkpiles, with broken springs, seats and a nasty film on everything. The drivers gave incorrect information about pickup times and had I not doubted every word the guy said from the start, we would have been stranded at the parks on more than one night. After all was said and done, we got a full refund from corporate, but these conditions were deplorable to say the least. The only things missing were a jailor and some nails in the beds to make them more comfy. DO NOT STAY HERE. This place gives hovels a good name and the only thing I am happy about was that I didn't get charged extra for the Hepititis I may have contracted in that hell hole.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: April 20, 2006....This is one of the worst places I have ever stayed in. It first started with the walk to our room. All rooms are accessed from the outside. Our room was located on the 3rd floor, some of the floor boards had holes covered up by carpeting, not a very good safety feature. Within minutes of entering the room, it had 3 strikes against it. First, when we entered the room it smelled like mildew, next I walked over to the sink to wash my hands and the handle fell off, I than went to pull a tissue out of the dispenser and the whole unit came out of the wall. This was all within a matter of 10 minutes. After deciding that it was too late (12:30am) to look for another room, we decided to just crash there for the night. I turned on the TV to help put me to sleep but had to turn it off because it was all snowy and the voice was all static. Morning couldn't come fast enough, we were up & out by 7:00am. On our walk to our car in the back parking lot we had to walk thru an outdoor hallway that was littered with empty cups, cigarettes and half eaten food, and to top it off a strong smell of urine. Luckily we were able to find a great hotel on Hotel Blvd, which was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “had no problem”
Reviews.Author: chevy05ruby
Reviews.Content: i was there in september of '05 and was surprised that i got more than what i expected. not just the price, but quality of the room. it not only looked clean, but it smelled clean and fresh. if your like me, i inspect the room first. then if i'm not happy, i go to the front desk and ask for another room. just keep going until you get a room that you are happy with. it's not like all rooms are bad. it's that simple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Koolkat
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay if wanting an above average place. Staff were great, rooms very clean, Tiki Bar was great other than the prices were a bit high but what do you expect when you are on a vacation. Pool was beautiful and clean. Very close to all Disney parks. We were on ground floor and NO bugs or varmits in the room....housekeeping good came in room every day and made beds and changed towels....as far as things to do we were right beside Old Town and tons of shopping and restaurants everywhere. I would definatley stay again. There were busy everynight and had security walking outside everynight. No problems with parking.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my goodness”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I could not believe that this decrepict Old Town hotel is still standing. The street appearance is very deceiving, and the staff are friendly enough. The room smelled so badly of mold that I had to open all the windows during the night. I was afraid of leaving as the room was pre-paid from online site. There is no high speed internet in the rooms, and the kiosk in the lobby is a piece of outdated garbage that didn't even work when I attempted to contact Days Inn to complain. If it was not 2:00 am when I checked in, and knew the area a little bit better I would have gladly forgotten about staying and moved on. Not a good experience, and moved onto better rooms the next day. If Days Inn wants to keep their reputation of good hotels, I would strongly recommend dropping this site from their properties list. I still shudder at the experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Basic Clean Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I paid $33/night (including taxes) using the AARP that I barely qualify for. My room was poolside, which means you don't have to look at the parking lot, but can be noisy when a lot of people are using the pool. I'd suggest trying for a room on an upper floor. In the lobby there is a person handing out welcome kits that tries to get you to take a time share tour. She wasn't very pushy and the kit has some useful samples. The room was clean, particularly the bathroom. Lots of soap, shampoo and towels with good hot water. I thought the bed especially comfortable. Normally I have trouble falling asleep in a different bed. Not here. My only complaint is that the TV was crap. Not a great picture and the volume control was disabled forcing me to listen at a slightly higer volume than I liked. Old Town is next door and is a good place for an evening stroll. It's very quiet early in the week, but picks up on Thursday & Friday. The A&W has decent hot dogs if you don't feel like a full meal. For much less than the least expensive room at WDW, this place was great. I will definitely look at staying here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wanted a clean cheap hotel to sleep at for 5 nights while visiting Disney. This hotel met all our needs. Rooms were very clean, beds are comfortable after spending all day at the parks, within walking distance to gift shops and Old-Towne. Would stay there again next year

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Oct. 2005. If you're looking for a well located, decently priced and fairly clean hotel stay here! I say fairly clean because the building was obviously built in the late 60's early 70's and shows some signs of average wear & tear. If you're used to staying in 12 star resorts and have a Seinfeldian neuroses about cleanliness, don't stay here. If you're an average working stiff with a wife and two kids and your own house doesn't look like "Lifestyles of the rich and famous." you'll be fine. The staff was very courteous and the hotel's proximity to Disney, Old Town, Walmart, Cvs, Walgreens and lots of cheap eateries, more then make up for any wear & tear the building has. We were there during hurricane Wilma and the hotel was great, very solid & the staff sent around daily bulletins of what to expect and what to do when Wilma finally hit. Like I said, it's a great hotel for working stiffs, if you think you're better then that, you probably won't be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: snail999
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to Days Inn and it was just as enjoyable as the first. I don't know where these other people are staying who have given it a bad review, they must be getting it mixed up with the Days Inn suites next door. We booked in late Saturday afternoon and service from reception was excellent. Within 15 minutes of booking in we were in our room. Yes, the rooms are basic, but what do you expect for the price. We were not planning to stay in the room that long, we are on holiday!! The rooms were clean, consisiting of two double beds, three chairs, table between the beds, side board with TV ect, bathroom with toilet, bath and shower and a seperate wash basin in the room. Enough for what we wanted. It may have that 70's feel about it but like I said, I have not travelled nearly 2,000 miles to sit in a room and watch tv. There is a large swimming pool with sun beds and chairs and a kids play area next to the pool. Location is fantastic, only a ten minute drive to the Disney parks and 15 to Sea World and Universal. Old town is only a minutes walk away where there are plenty of old style shops, bars, entertainment, pubs, eating houses, and rides. Perfect place to relax after a hard day at the parks. Close enough to walk to but far away enough to not be noisy. Just across the road are plenty of shops and reasuarants, with the Western Sizzler opposite that does a great breakfast buffett for $3.99. We were there every morning, stuffing our faces and that lasted till be returned from the parks. I can not praise this place highly enough, and can not understand the moaners who pay a cheap price but expect Super Gold standard. We are already planning to come back here next year. Looking for somewhere to stay so you have more money in your pocket , then this is the place to come. All the staff are very friendly and helpfull. Our room was cleaned everyday with new linen each day.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty run down. The bathroom had peeling paint over the shower, the beds were stiff, the pillows were paper thin, and I really didn't get a good night's rest. The pool was decent, but overloaded with chlorine. Didn't try the 3.99 breakfast buffet because the western sizzle right across the street had the same deal and probably better quality and selection.

Reviews.Title: “Glad that we were only there for eight hours to sleep”
Reviews.Author: mklein123
Reviews.Content: I sure wish that I would have read the other reviews of this place before I booked it. I should have been suspicious when I saw the Orbitz rate of $39; however I've had good luck at several other Days Inns so I just thought that I was getting a good deal. Was I wrong. We arrived at about 11:30 p.m. after a long (and very hot day at Sea World) and a visit to some old neighbors in Windermere. The check-in is located in a strip mall and the area is a bit seedy, imho. The room was relatively clean (thank goodness), however it was in serious need of a paint job and new carpet. The paint in the bathroom was peeling (about a 2x2 foot area was stripped to the drywall) and several other walls were pretty badly scuffed. At least the air conditioner was working. We had a decent night's sleep but were extremely glad to leave early the next morning to go to Discovery Cove.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before you go here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cheap hotel, I paid about $50 on Orbitz. Someone else was checking in at the same time and paid $35 for same room. First room was a complete mess. The AC was broken, there was dust everywhere and a stain on the carpet. I called the main desk, they said they would send someone shortly. No one came. I called the desk and demanded a new room. New room was MUCH better but still could have used a thorough cleaning. Pool was nice. Buffet breakfast was eh. (Across the street there are 2 buffets that are the same price and MUCH better.) The parking lot was crowded and someone damaged the antenna on our rental. I did not feel safe here. The bottom line for this hotel: Cheap and you get what you pay for. If all you want is a clean bed then is the place for you. If you want anything more, try somewhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Maingate East
HotelInfo.Address: 5840 West Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway, Kissimmee, FL 34746
